content: The Lord Implored to Defend the Psalmist against the Wicked.
An Ode of David, [perhaps in a wild, irregular, enthusiastic strain,] which he sang to the  concerning the words of Cush, a Benjamite.
Save me and rescue me from all those who pursue me,
So that my enemy will not tear me like a lion,
Dragging me away while there is no one to rescue [me].
